books.author: George Orwell
books.summary: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society where the government, headed by Big Brother, controls every aspect of people's lives. The protagonist, Winston Smith, starts to question the system and begins a forbidden love affair, leading to dire consequences.
books.quote: Freedom is the freedom to say that two plus two make four. If that is granted, all else follows.

books.title: Animal Farm
books.author: George Orwell
books.summary: A political allegory about a group of farm animals who overthrow their human farmer and establish a society based on equality. However, the pigs in charge gradually become corrupt and oppressive, leading to a new form of tyranny.
books.quote: All animals are equal, but some animals are more equal than others.

books.title: Eleven Minutes
books.author: Paulo Coelho
books.summary: A novel about a young Brazilian girl named Maria who goes to Geneva, Switzerland in search of love and adventure. She ends up working as a prostitute and finds that her experiences lead her to understand the true nature of love and sexuality.
books.literaryAwards: Brida was nominated for the International IMPAC Dublin Literary Award (1999).
books.quote: Everything tells me that I am about to make a wrong decision, but making mistakes is just part of life. What does the world want of me? Does it want me to take no risks, to go back to where I came from because I didn't have the courage to say “yes” to life?

books.title: Of Mice and Men
books.author: John Steinbeck
books.summary: A novella about two migrant workers, George and Lennie, who are searching for work during the Great Depression. They dream of owning a farm together, but their hopes are shattered by tragic events.
books.setting: Soledad, California, USA during the Great Depression
books.literaryAwards: New York Drama Critics' Circle Award (1938), Spur Award for Best Juvenile Fiction (1938)
books.quote: The best laid schemes o' mice an' men / Gang aft a-gley.

books.title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
books.author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
books.summary: A novel that tells the story of the Buendia family over seven generations in the fictional town of Macondo. The novel explores themes of love, family, solitude, and the cyclical nature of history.
books.setting: Macondo, a fictional town in Colombia
books.literaryAwards: Nobel Prize in Literature (1982), Neustadt International Prize for Literature (1972)
books.quote: Many years later, as he faced the firing squad, Colonel Aureliano Buendia was to remember that distant afternoon when his father took him to discover ice.

books.title: The Bad Beginning (A Series of Unfortunate Events)
books.author: Daniel Handler
books.summary: The first book in a series about three orphaned siblings who are sent to live with their distant relative Count Olaf, who is after their inheritance. The siblings must use their wits and skills to outsmart Count Olaf and his evil plans.
books.literaryAwards: Colorado Blue Spruce Young Adult Book Award Nominee (2002), Nevada Young Readers' Award Nominee for Intermediate Category (2001)
books.quote: ...you know that a good, long session of weeping can often make you feel better, even if your circumstances have not changed one bit.

books.title: The Little Prince
books.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
books.summary: A classic tale first published in 1945, telling the story of a pilot forced to land in the desert, and his meeting with a little prince who tells him wise and wonderful tales.
books.literaryAwards: Retro Hugo Award for Best Novella (2019)
books.quote: And now here is my secret, a very simple secret: it is only with the heart that one can see rightly; what is essential is invisible to the eye.

books.title: The Name of the Wind (The Kingkiller Chronicle, #1)
books.author: Patrick Rothfuss
books.summary: An epic fantasy about a legendary wizard named Kvothe who tells his life story to a scribe called Chronicler. He recounts his time as a traveling performer, student at a magical university, and his quest for revenge against those who killed his family.
books.setting: Imre, The University, The Waystone Inn, and various other locations in the fantasy world of Temerant
books.literaryAwards: Quill Award for Science Fiction/Fantasy/Horror (2007), Alex Award (2008)
books.quote: It was night again. The Waystone Inn lay in silence, and it was a silence of three parts.
